instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the quantitative analysis of epigoitrin, geniposide, baicalin, berberine hydrochloride, and density in the rapid monitoring methods for quality control of the concentration process of lanqin oral solution (LOS)?
Output: The quantitative analysis of epigoitrin, geniposide, baicalin, berberine hydrochloride, and density in the rapid monitoring methods for quality control of the concentration process of lanqin oral solution (LOS) used near-infrared spectroscopy (NIRs).

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the construction of the quantitative models for epigoitrin, geniposide, baicalin, berberine hydrochloride, and density in the rapid monitoring methods for quality control of the concentration process of lanqin oral solution (LOS)?
Output: Standard normal variate (SNV) transformation, multiplicative scatter correction (MSC), moving window spectral matrix smoothing (nirmaf), normalization, and Savitzky-Golay (SG) smoothing were used in the construction of the quantitative models for epigoitrin, geniposide, baicalin, berberine hydrochloride, and density in the rapid monitoring methods for quality control of the concentration process of lanqin oral solution (LOS).

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the performancein the quantitative analysis of epigoitrin, geniposide, baicalin, berberine hydrochloride, and density in the rapid monitoring methods for quality control of the concentration process of lanqin oral solution (LOS), and how far can this metric go in terms of accuracy?
Output:
The metric chosen to evaluate the performance of the quantitative models in this study is the relative standard error of calibration (RSEC). The RSEC values obtained for epigoitrin, geniposide, baicalin, berberine hydrochloride, and density were 3.80%, 3.75%, 3.79%, 11.5%, and 1.22% respectively. 

The accuracy of the RSEC metric can be considered satisfactory in this study.

instruction: What machine learning models were used in the rapid monitoring methods for quality control of the concentration process of lanqin oral solution (LOS) using near-infrared spectroscopy (NIRs) and chemometrics?
Output: The machine learning models used in the rapid monitoring methods for quality control of the concentration process of lanqin oral solution (LOS) using near-infrared spectroscopy (NIRs) and chemometrics are Partial Least Squares Regression (PLSR) and Genetic Algorithm Joint Extreme Learning Machine (GA-ELM).

instruction: Can the combination of near-infrared spectroscopy (NIRs) and chemometrics be considered superior to traditional methods for rapid monitoring of the concentration process of lanqin oral solution (LOS) in terms of quality control?
Output: Yes, the combination of near-infrared spectroscopy (NIRs) and chemometrics can be considered superior to traditional methods for rapid monitoring of the concentration process of lanqin oral solution (LOS) in terms of quality control. The past study developed rapid monitoring methods using NIRs and chemometrics for the quality control of the concentration process of LOS. The quantitative models constructed using partial least squares regression (PLSR) showed satisfactory results with low relative standard error values for various components of LOS. Additionally, the qualitative analysis using the genetic algorithm joint extreme learning machine (GA-ELM) achieved 100% prediction accuracy in distinguishing the end point of the concentration process. These results indicate that the combination of NIRs and chemometrics has great potential in improving the efficiency and accuracy of quality control in the production of LOS.
